title: How do writers choose which idea to pursue? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, for me, it’s all about what really ignites my curiosity. If I have to choose between two ideas, I pursue the one that seems to have the richer content for the story. Sometimes I don’t know until I research the topic thoroughly. Sometimes I don’t know until I start working on it. Occasionally an idea just doesn’t go anywhere compelling, in which case I leave it and pursue the next idea for a while. My Great Library series took a total of 10 years, off and on, to develop to where I could actually write it and do justice to the idea. I probably started different approaches four times during that decade before finding the one that finally worked. All of which is to say, there’s not really a roadmap, or a hard-and-fast process for me. Some things click immediately. Some things take years. It’s really hard to know.

For me, I simply choose a place or a topic with which I am familiar. If asked, I probably could write a nice story about Cincinnati, Ohio, but since I have never visited there, I would have to do a lot of dull research. On the other hand I could sit down now and write you a story about Thelma, Texas where I once lived for a few months.
